headline: Blood Boils And Scores Are Settled
abstract: “The American People, Volume 2” is a sprawling, angry, intimate book about the dawn of the AIDS crisis and the carnage and neglect that ensued.
lead_paragraph: When the first volume of Larry Kramer’s epic “The American People” appeared in 2015, it contained not one epigraph at its front but 12. The one that mattered most was from Samuel Beckett’s “Malone Dies.” Beckett’s words might have served as an alternate title for this unbuttoned pair of novels: “Let me say before I go any further that I forgive nobody.”
keywords: The American People: Volume 2: The Brutality of Fact (Book)
